entry.title: [GRA5/GRA7/GRA9/SBG5/WAW1/SGP1/BHS5/SYD1][Public cloud] - End of life for Kubernetes 1.18
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Sep 6, 07:00 UTC  -  Sep 8, 15:00 UTC

Jun 3, 02:35 UTC
Scheduled - Start time : 06/09/2022 07:00 UTC
End time : 08/09/2022 15:00 UTC
Service impact : Every Kubernetes 1.18 will be force upgraded to the next minor version (1.19)
Service improvement: The aim of this maintenance is to upgrade a deprecated cluster to a supported newer version

entry.title: [SGP2][Public Cloud] Upgrade to Stein
entry.content:
THIS IS A SCHEDULED EVENT Aug 17, 06:00 - 14:00 UTC

Jun 15, 23:33 UTC
Scheduled - A maintenance operation is scheduled for the SGP2 region on August 17, 2022, between 06:00 and 14:00 (UTC). No disruption is expected on your instances. Some APIs will remain unreachable during the operation.

The API endpoints that will be maintained are the following:
https://compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://network.compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://volume.compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://image.compute.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://workflow.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net
https://orchestration.sgp2.cloud.ovh.net

The other regions will remain accessible by API and via your OVH manager.
This operation allows us to prepare for the future. Thanks to this OpenStack upgrade, we will be able to continue to improve our Public Cloud offering by providing you with new features in the coming months.
The API calls you are used to using will not change, this new version is backwards compatible with the old one.
The target versions of the OpenStack components in this region will be:
Glance : 18 (Stein) ;
Cinder : 14 (Stein) ;
Nova : 19 (Stein) ;
Neutron : 14 (Stein) ;
Heat : 12 (Stein) ;

The components not affected by this operation are :
Keystone : 11 (Ocata) ;
Swift : 2.25 (Ussuri) ;
Horizon : 13 (Queens) ;
Mistral : 7 (Rocky) ;

This update is an important step in the development of the product. Other regions will be concerned by equivalent developments in the coming weeks. To know the detail of the new functionalities, go to https://releases.openstack.org/stein/highlights.html
Compute (Nova) https://docs.openstack.org/nova/stein/reference/api-microversion-history.html#maximum-in-newton
Network (Neutron) https://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/neutron/stein.html
Volume (Cinder) https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/contributor/api_microversion_history.html#maximum-in-newton
If you want to test the behavior of the updated software versions you can use the GRA9 and SBG7 regions which already expose the target versions.

entry.title: [US-EAST-VA-1][Instance Backup] - 404 and 503 Error
entry.content:
Jul 25, 10:06 UTC
Resolved - Start Time : 06/07/2022 09:00 UTC
End Time : 25/07/2022 06:00 UTC
Service impact : We no longer observe 404 and 503 errors
Root cause : Our teams have increased the storage capacities and proceeded to a new load balancing on our infrastructure

Jul 12, 08:39 UTC
Update - Update : Incident still ongoing, resolution is being processed and will take some time. We will get back to you as soon as a significant progress is visible.

Jul 6, 09:51 UTC
Identified - Initial investigation indicates that block storage and volume snapshot products are not impacted.
A fix is currently being tested.
We'll be back shortly once the test has been validated and is being deployed.

Jul 6, 09:33 UTC
Investigating - Start time : 06/07/2022 09:00 UTC
Service impact : We observe temporary 404 on GET method and 503 on PUT method, both due to misplaced objects.
Ongoing actions : Our teams investigate to resolve the situation.

entry.title: [Worldwide][Public Cloud] VPS-Neutron network issue
entry.content:
Jul 25, 10:28 UTC
Update - Work in progress to resolve the issue.
Majority of the regions improved. Impact is mainly SBG5, SBG6, SBG7, SBG8 and UK1 regions.

Jul 25, 09:01 UTC
Identified - Start time : 23/07/2022 04:00 UTC
Service impact : An issue has been discovered relating to the networking component (Neutron). The impact can be observed on both public and private networks.
Impact is limited and not all VMs are impacted. The bug may not impact a VM, but after action such as reboot or migration may cause issues with network.
Workaround : We recommend avoiding actions such as restart and reinstall of instances.
Ongoing actions : The bug is identified and the teams are mobilised to resolve the issue as soon as possible.
